articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kwail County
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kwail County

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to Kwail County.
					
					 First he dropped in at the Kwail County Revolutionary Museum and a room devoted to the history of the county.
					
					 Displayed at the museum are precious data on immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung who turned the county into a world-class orchard and the course through which the county made a history of earth-shaking changes under the wise leadership of the WPK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il looked round with deep impression the data displayed at the museum one after another. 
					
					 A new history of Kwail County began when the President chose this area as suitable for an orchard, looking at the map during the Fatherland Liberation War, and sent hundreds of thousands of fruit saplings there. Being told about this fact, Kim Jong Il recalled the President's devoted efforts for the development of the county.
					
					 At the room devoted to the history of the county Kim Jong Il looked round with keen interest data on the successes gained by the county under the Party's guidance over the past years.
					
					 He toured various parts of the county to acquaint himself with their modernization and fruit production. 
					
					 Commanding a panoramic view of the vast orchard, he praised the party members and other working people of the county for having done a lot true to the WPK's policy of pomiculture. 
					
					  Going round the Pomicultural Institute, he learned about the researches into fruit culture and indicated the tasks and ways to be carried out by the institute.  
					
					 He acquainted himself with the culture of a new kind of willow which grows fast, greatly helping produce fruit containers including baskets and solve the problem of firewood for the people in the county. He gave high appreciation.
					
					 He set forth tasks facing the county.
					
					 He said that the county is very favorable for the development of fruit farming in terms of such natural conditions as the height, the percentage of sunshine, accumulated temperature and soil.
					
					 A vigorous drive to put the fruit production on a highly scientific, modern and intensive basis should be conducted to radically develop pomiculture in keeping with the requirements of developing reality, he said.
					
					 He stressed the need to mass-plant short apple trees and positively introduce good seeds in order to increase the fruit production.
					
					 It is important to enhance the function and role of the Pomicultural Institute and other relevant units in order to ensure the manuring and cultivation of fruit trees on a scientific and technological basis, raise the fruit yield per hectare and actively introduce advanced technology, he said.
					
					 He also underlined the need to meticulously organize the work for activating the production at fruit processing base.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and chief of the KPA General Staff, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, Kim Kyong Ok and Han Kwang Sang, first vice department directors of the C.C., the WPK, and KPA Generals Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong and Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Mauritania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Mauritania

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz, president of Islamic Republic of Mauritania, on its 51st independence day.
					
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and the people of Mauritania greater successes in their efforts for the country's stability and the socio-economic development.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Albanian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Albanian President

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greeting to Bamir Topi, president of Albania, on its national day.
					
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished Albania development and prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Albanian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Albanian PM

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK premier Friday sent a message of greeting to Albanian Prime Minister Sali Berisha on its national day.
					
					 The message wished the PM successes in the work for the country's development.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Albanian Foreign Minister Edmond Haxhinasto.

articles.title: KPA Soldiers Demand Tougher Counteraction to Enemies' Provocation
articles.content:
KPA Soldiers Demand Tougher Counteraction to Enemies' Provocation

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Soldiers of the Korean People's Army are raising their demand for tougher counteraction as regards the fact that the south Korean warmongers recently staged the large-scale anti-DPRK war exercises on five islands in the West Sea of Korea with the first anniversary of the Yonphyong Island incident as an occasion.
					
					 Officer Kim Ho Chol (male, 43) said: "We can no longer tolerate the south Korean military warmongers' reckless military provocations. We should blow out the citadel of aggressors by giving free rein to our will to annihilate the enemies."
					
					 Officer Pak Yong Sim (female, 26), said:
					
					 Reenacting the Yonphyong Island incident with huge armed forces involved, the puppet warmongers announced that they would attack "not only base of provocation by someone but also supporters." They even staged a drill of "returning fire" under the conception of "measure first and report later".
					
					 The enemies are pushing ahead with anti-DPRK war moves in all aspects at fast tempo.
					
					 This is a grave military provocation and blackmail to the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces' ceaseless provocations, aimed at igniting a war against the DPRK, are touching off surging wrath and hatred from among all the servicepersons of his unit, officer Kim Jong Su (male, 58) said, adding: 
					
					 The puppet forces should not run amuck, clearly mindful that their every movement is at the gun-sights of the KPA soldiers burning with revengeful thought.
					
					 If the enemies dare unleash a war, the KPA will clearly show the might of its arms.
					
					 Those impairing the DPRK's dignity even a bit will never go scot-free no matter wherever they are.

articles.title: US Warlike Forces Accused of Slandering DPRK
articles.content:
US Warlike Forces Accused of Slandering DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The nominee for assistant secretary of the U.S. Department of Defense, told at a recent Senate Armed Services Committee hearing that the DPRK's missiles and "WMD program" pose a serious and direct threat to the U.S.' allies in the region and its territory and that the DPRK is engaged in "WMD proliferation". Other department officials have parroted such remarks.
					
					 Commenting on this, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun Sunday says:
					
					 Their slanders to the DPRK fully reveal once again that the U.S. is the arch criminal in wrecking peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The demeanor of the U.S. warlike forces is as shameless as a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 What they have sought in distorting the truth is to brand the DPRK as a "threat" to the U.S.' allies in the region and its territory and then justify the U.S. hostile policy for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 Another aim is to legitimate the U.S. military reinforcement in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 It is no accident that the U.S. is intensifying the smear campaign against the DPRK with false and fabricated data. This is a last-ditch effort of those frightened at the fact that the U.S. is further getting isolated worldwide while the DPRK's international prestige is remarkably rising. 
					
					 The U.S. belligerent forces are making desperate efforts as much as possible to browbeat and subjugate the DPRK, but their scheme is bound to face failure.
					
					 With any slander the U.S. can neither impair the high external authority of the DPRK nor frighten the Korean people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hits GNP of S. Korea for Railroading FTA
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hits GNP of S. Korea for Railroading FTA

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the "Grand National Party" of south Korea railroaded the "motion calling for ratification of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement" through the "National Assembly". It is a despicable action intended to maintain power by selling off the dignity and interests of the nation to curry favor with the U.S. master. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The GNP clan single-handedly railroaded the motion through the NA after excluding opposition parties, the commentary notes, and says:
					
					 This fully revealed again the true colors of the GNP as a traitor which has engaged itself only in evil policy with arrogance and arbitrariness, trampling down the will and demand of the people.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group's bid for conclusion of the FTA with the U.S. is aimed to tide over the ruling crisis in reliance on the U.S. and escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the conservative group is scheming to intensify the war provocative moves for invasion of the DPRK in collusion with its U.S master by strengthening the "alliance" with it.
					
					 This was well proven by the group's remarks that the FTA with the U.S. is of "very high value in terms of security" rather than economy.
					
					 The conservative group, which does not hesitate to sell off the dignity and interests of the nation to foreigners only to maintain its power and do harm to the fellow countrymen, is the modern-type five traitors of 1905 to be cursed by Koreans forever.

articles.title: Provokers Will Have to Pay Dearly: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Provokers Will Have to Pay Dearly: KCNA Commentary

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- An extremely grave political and military tension has prevailed on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean military warmongers kicked off large-scale anti-DPRK war rehearsal on the five islands and their surrounding waters in the West Sea of Korea on November 23.
					
					 Taking place again in the west sea is the same military action as was at the time of the provocation from Yonphyong Island shaking the world one year ago.
					
					 Shells are fired in direction to the DPRK's territorial waters and the West Sea area is clouded with smoke of cannons due to madcap military exercises for fratricidal war.
					
					 All Koreans are enraged at such extra-large political and military provocation by the group of traitors oblivious of lesson taught by the Yonphyong Island shelling. 
					
					 The rehearsal is of bellicosity in term of its purpose.
					
					 The military warmongers asserted that the rehearsal was aimed to review their "perfect readiness for counteraction and to show their will to decisively punish "not only the base of provocation but also commanding posts of all echelons including supporters in the north" with the combined forces of three services in case the DPRK starts a military action.
					
					 It is the height of impudence for the provocateurs to talk about the base of provocation by somebody.
					
					 Last year's Yonphyong Island shelling was a legitimate self-defensive step against the provocateurs who dared to make a clumsy fire on the inviolable territorial waters of the DPRK despite its army's advance warning.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers' anti-DPRK war rehearsal, launched on the first anniversary of the shelling, is intended to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and ignite a war against the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 They have already turned the area of five islands in the West Sea into a stronghold for military showdown with the DPRK, a base for attack on it, and renewed the operation posture in this area.
					
					 Changed were the operational guidelines of the Command for Defense of Islands in Northwest Sea of the puppet army, stemmed from the Marine Corps Command after the Yonphyong Island incident, and its operation theatre was expanded. The Command for Defense of Islands in Northwest Sea was allowed to conduct any operation on its own initiative in case of "provocation" by someone in Paekryong and Yonphyong islands, etc. 
					
					 The military warmongers concentrated their armed forces and various kinds of war equipment on the five islands in the west sea and reinforced marine corps and warships. In the meantime they frequently staged drill of dropping depth-bombs and let maritime patrol plane P-3C make close flights above the waters around the islands.
					
					 What can not be overlooked is the fact that involved in the rehearsal were the puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff, Command for Defense of Islands in Northwest Sea, Naval Force Operation Command, Air Force Operation Command and huge armed forces of the three services.
					
					 All the facts go to prove that the south Korean warmongers seek to commit a new military provocation in the west sea and then lead it to an all-out war against the DPRK. 
					
					 They must be aware that a small military clash in the Korean Peninsula may lead to a total war all at once.
					
					 So, the above said rehearsal is very dangerous developments.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces, however, are sadly mistaken.
					
					 Things will turn out quite differently now that they, oblivious of the lesson from the Yonphyong Island shelling a year ago, have made a frontal challenge to the DPRK, daringly impairing its dignity.  
					
					 The flames of the Yonphyong Island will turn into those of thousand-fold revenge to reduce the stronghold of the group of traitors into ashes. 
					
					 Only miserable end awaits those getting hell-bent on reckless confrontation and war moves.
					
					 They will have to pay dearly for what they do.

articles.title: Struggle to Expel Group of Traitors Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle to Expel Group of Traitors Urged in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public a statement on Nov. 23 in denunciation of the puppet group keen on sycophancy and treachery.
					
					 The statement charged that the present "government" and the "Grand National Party" left the economy of south Korea and its people's lives to the mercy of the U.S.
					
					 The "Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S. is a traitorous agreement serving only a handful of big businesses yet threatening the population's existence, it said.
					
					 We will never pardon those traitors who do not hesitate to do anything for meeting the U.S.' demand, it said.
					
					 The statement called for wiping out the group of pro-American traitors that railroaded the treacherous "motion for ratification of FTA" by dint of dictatorial power.

articles.title: Police's Violence Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police's Violence Slammed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore carried an editorial on November 25 to condemn the puppet police's violence on the protesters.
					
					 On Nov. 23 the police fired water cannons toward the people staging a demo in Seoul to protest the railroaded "motion for ratification of the Free Trade Agreement", the editorial noted, branding this as a serious violation of human rights.
					
					 The Police Agency ordered local police offices across south Korea to use water cannons against demonstrators, it charged, adding:
					
					 Jo Hyon O, chief of the Police Agency, stirred up violence, instructing the policemen to actively use small arms. 
					
					 It is just for the people to express anger at the railroaded motion which sacrifices 99 percent of the population only for one percent, and any violence can never check the candlelight actions.

articles.title: Police's Cruel Repression of Protesters Censured
articles.content:
Police's Cruel Repression of Protesters Censured

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Nov. 24 in denunciation of the police's murderous violence.
					
					 The police are getting hell-bent, bereft of reason, on the repression of the protesters standing against the conclusion of the "Free Trade Agreement", the commentary said, adding:
					
					 Typical of such deeds is the fact that the police fired water cannons toward the participants in the candlelight rally and took away them at random on Nov. 22.
					
					 The use of this repressive equipment in the chilly weather caused heavy damage as skin mauling.
					
					 This shows that the police have defined the citizens as enemy to attack them.
					
					 The people's will against the FTA can never be broken with any violence, the commentary stated, demanding that the head of the Seoul district police office, close to the chief executive, step down at once, taking the blame for directing the recent crackdown.

articles.title: US, S. Korean Authorities' War Moves Flailed Worldwide
articles.content:
US, S. Korean Authorities' War Moves Flailed Worldwide

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries supporting peace and reunification of Korea in their messages and letters have expressed wrath at the criminal action of the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors.
					
					 Alberto Moreno, general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), charged that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are resorting to the provocative moves for war, bringing to naught all the achievements made for national reconciliation and reunification. Our Party and the Peruvian people bitterly denounce such actions, he said.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said that the south Korean authorities have cooked up various cases at the instigation of the U.S. to extremely deteriorate the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 We fully support the self-defensive measures taken by the DPRK to cope with the prevailing situation, he said.
					
					 Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the U.S. is engrossed in realizing its ambition to dominate Korea as a whole while the south Korean authorities are joining in the U.S. moves in a bid to stay in power.
					
					 Julio Ballesteros Espin, chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People, said that it is essential for the Korean nation to reject the outsiders' interference in order to put an end to the tragedy of its division.
					
					 Thomas Losh, chief of the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna of Austria, noted that the U.S. and its followers are still now increasing the danger of a war.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are staging madcap military exercises against the DPRK, he said, strongly urging them to stop such actions.

articles.title: Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Uganda
articles.content:
Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Uganda

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Uganda on Nov. 21 on the theme of "Immortal Juche idea founded by the great President Kim Il Sung and reality of socialist Korea."
					
					 On display in its venue were photos showing General Secretary Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities and publications on Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were teachers and students of Kyambogo University.
					
					 John Nayoga Mukasa, head of the Juche Idea Study Group of the Department of Teacher Education and Expansion of Kyambogo University, said that the immortal Juche idea has been widely disseminated to the world for its validity and vitality.
					
					 It has become an irresistible trend of the times to follow the Juche idea, the head said, adding that independence and prosperity of Uganda would be realized when it advances under the banner of this idea.
					
					 Other speakers explained the great vitality of the Juche idea and expressed their resolve to intensify the study and dissemination of the idea.

articles.title: Bulletin Issued by Bangladeshi Organization
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued by Bangladeshi Organization

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee issued a bulletin titled "Architecture of DPRK" on Nov. 22.
					
					 New many buildings including dwelling houses in Pyongyang are being erected in the DPRK, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 In the DPRK architecture strictly serves the people and each structure is built for the working masses.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK government to give top priority to convenience of the people in building such industrial establishments as power station and factory as well as service facilities, theatre, cinema and hospital, and perfect their construction on a high level.
					
					 The DPRK widely introduces the achievements by modern science and technology in all fields of construction so as to provide impeccable buildings enough to be acclaimed by posterity.
					
					 It ensures speed and highest quality in construction to erect structures as edifices of eternal value.
					
					 Formative and artistic representation of architecture is being introduced in an overall way in the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Answers Evoke Great Sensation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Answers Evoke Great Sensation

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's answers to questions put by ITAR-TASS of Russia have evoked a great echo on the world public as the absolute truth that helps defend the peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world and brightly shows the road ahead of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The director general of ITAR-TASS said that the answers aroused tremendous response from among the Russian people and were reported by hundreds of domestic and foreign media to become a great event of the public.
					
					 The Dagestan Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia in a statement praised the answers as important action guidelines for further strengthening the Russia-DPRK friendly relations and ensuring the global peace and stability.
					
					 The answers give great strength and courage to the peoples of countries aspiring after independence, stressed the chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy in a statement said that the DPRK government's stand on peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world, denuclearization of the peninsula in particular, clarified by Kim Jong Il in his answers, is most fair and aboveboard.
					
					 The chairman of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea stated that the Korean people would win only victories in the future, too, rallied closer around Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico said that Kim Jong Il has raised the dignity and honor of the Korean nation to the maximum and made signal contributions to the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Finnish Mangyongdae Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung praised Kim Jong Il as the great master of diplomacy who has displayed distinguished caliber in consolidating not only the DPRK-Russia friendship but the world peace, stability and friendship through his energetic external activities.

articles.title: Shaking Citadel of Capitalism: AAPSO
articles.content:
Shaking Citadel of Capitalism: AAPSO

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization (AAPSO) in a statement on Nov. 23 said that the citadel of capitalism is shaking as the capitalist crisis is expanding to a new scope.
					
					 The ruling parties were defeated in Italy, Greece, Spain and Portugal due to the debt issue, dealing a heavy blow at the whole continent of Europe, the statement said.
					
					 The impossible settlement of the debt issue is arousing big concern in the U.S., too, it noted.
					
					 Now the chief executive of a Western country is begging for funds needed for economic recovery from an African country, its former colony, it said, adding this is a miserable lot of the West.
					
					 Condemning the police for cracking down on the demonstrators against Wall Street in New York, it stressed that AAPSO is standing firm on the side of the people's movement and expresses solidarity with them in the worldwide movement against the greed of the world monopolies.

articles.title: Anti-epidemic in Cuba
articles.content:
Anti-epidemic in Cuba

					 Havana, November 26 (KCNA) -- Cuba recently started vaccination to prevent epidemic.
					
					 For this work the country prepared vaccines effective against three kinds of epidemic virus including A(H1N1) and A(H3N2).
					
					 Over 500,000 citizens would be vaccinated.

articles.title: Iran Adopts Offensive Strategy When Facing Enemies
articles.content:
Iran Adopts Offensive Strategy When Facing Enemies

					 Tehran, November 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme Leader’s Senior Military Advisor Major General Seyyed Yahya Rahim-Safavi said in a speech at a meeting on Thursday Iran will adopt an offensive strategy when facing enemies and at the same time retaliate any threats.
					
					　"We expect politicians and lawmakers to retaliate any threats while our international enemies are seeking to put more economic and political pressures on Iran and impose sanctions against it," Safavi said. 
					
					 He said the Iranian army and Islamic Revolution's Guards Corps are fully prepared to defend the country. 
					
					 "If enemies insist on military actions Iranians will give them a crushing response," he said.

articles.title: Iran Labels US, West as Wreckers of Regional Stability
articles.content:
Iran Labels US, West as Wreckers of Regional Stability

					 Tehran, November 26 (KCNA) -- Iran's police chief in a speech at a meeting on Nov. 23 labeled the United States and the West as wreckers of the regional stability.
					
					 The U.S. and its satellites have kept their armed forces in the region for the past ten years under the pretext of "anti-terrorism" but it has wrecked stability and increased terrorist acts, organized crimes and drug trafficking, he said.
					
					 The regional countries should ensure the regional stability through collective cooperation, he stressed.

articles.title: NATO Air Strike Kills 6 Afghan Children
articles.content:
NATO Air Strike Kills 6 Afghan Children

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Seven civilians, including 
					
					six children, were killed and two girls also were injured on Wednesday in a NATO air strike near the southern Afghanistan province of Kandahar, officials said Thursday

articles.title: Portugal Braces for General Strike against Austerity
articles.content:
Portugal Braces for General Strike against Austerity

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A 24-hour strike in Portugal has grounded flights and halted the public transportation in protest against proposed austerity measures.
					
					 Air traffic controllers and workers on Lisbon's metro system were the first to go on strike late on Wednesday.
					
					 They are expected to be joined by hundreds of thousands of other workers, including teachers and hospital staff.
					
					 They strongly demanded the immediate removal of the austerity measures which brought about higher unemployment rate.

articles.title: Global Health Situation
articles.content:
Global Health Situation

					 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- An estimated 2.7 billion people live in countries with no safety net to cover medical costs, World Health Organization Director-General Margaret Chan said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Turkmen President Visits China
articles.content:
Turkmen President Visits China

					 Beijing, November 26 (KCNA) -- Turkmen President Gurbanguly Berdymuhamedov visited China from Nov. 22 to 25.
					
					 During the visit he had talks with Chinese President Hu Jintao and had conversations respectively with Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council of China.
					
					 Discussed at the talks and conversations were the issue of boosting bilateral relations and regional and international issues of mutual concern.
					
					 Staying in China the Turkmen president went round Shenzhen City and Hong Kong and participated in an event on commissioning the natural gas pipeline from Turkmenistan to Guangdong Province of China.

articles.title: Test Flight of Fifth Generation of Fighter Plane in Russia
articles.content:
Test Flight of Fifth Generation of Fighter Plane in Russia

					 Moscow, November 26 (KCNA) -- A test flight of the fifth generation of fighter plane was conducted in Russia recently.
					
					 The fighter plane flew for about one hour and successfully carried out its duty. It is said that in the course of the flight the solidity of the fighter plane was verified and the operation of its power devices estimated.

articles.title: Iran Not to Give up Right to Nuclear Development
articles.content:
Iran Not to Give up Right to Nuclear Development

					 Tehran, November 26 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in a speech at a meeting on Nov. 23 clarified the stand not to give up the right to nuclear development for peaceful purpose.
					
					 The U.S. and some Western countries are escalating sanctions against Iran over its nuclear issue. In this regard he denounced the hostile forces for working hard to block Iran's development, nuclear and scientific and technological development, in particular, under various pretexts.
					
					 Iran will never pardon the slightest act of encroaching upon the country's right to nuclear development for peaceful purpose, he stressed.
